contentrichtext.text: {{about|an island|the city|Ishigaki, Okinawa}} {{Infobox islands | name = Ishigaki<br>石垣島 | image name = Kabira Bay Ishigaki Island30s3s4592.jpg | image caption = [[Kabira Bay]] | image size = 250px | native name = | native name link = | nickname = | location = [[Pacific Ocean]] | locator map = {{Location map|Japan|caption=|float=center|width=220|relief=1|lat=24.4667|long=124.233}} | map caption = Ishigaki Island (Japan) | relief =1 | coordinates = | archipelago = [[Yaeyama Islands]] | total islands = | major islands = | area_km2 = | length_km = | width_km = | highest mount = | elevation_m = | country = Japan | country admin divisions title = Prefecture | country admin divisions = [[Okinawa Prefecture]] | country admin divisions title 1 = | country admin divisions 1 = | country admin divisions title 2 = | country admin divisions 2 = | country largest city = | country largest city population = | population = around 48,000 | population as of = | density_km2 = | ethnic groups = | additional info = }} {{nihongo|'''Ishigaki'''|石垣島|Ishigaki-jima|[[Yaeyama language|Yaeyama]] and [[Okinawan language|Okinawan]]: ''Ishigachi''}} is a Japanese island west of [[Okinawa Hontō]] and the second-largest island of the [[Yaeyama Islands|Yaeyama Island group]]. It is within the [[Ishigaki, Okinawa|City of Ishigaki]] in [[Okinawa Prefecture]]. The city functions as the business and transport center of the archipelago. The island is served by [[New Ishigaki Airport]], the largest airport in the Yaeyamas. Much of the island and surrounding waters including [[Mount Omoto]] and [[Kabira Bay]] are protected as part of [[Iriomote-Ishigaki National Park]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.env.go.jp/en/nature/nps/park/parks/iriomote_3.html |title=Introducing places of interest: Iriomote-Ishigaki National Park (Ishigakijima) |publisher=[[Ministry of the Environment (Japan)|Ministry of the Environment]] |accessdate=15 February 2012}}</ref> Ishigaki Island, like the rest of Okinawa, is culturally influenced by both Japan and [[Taiwan]] ‒ as well as [[China]] ‒ due to its location off the north eastern coast of Taiwan. A [[tsunami]] of record height hit Ishigaki Island in 1771.<ref>[http://ir.lib.u-ryukyu.ac.jp/bitstream/123456789/8549/1/p125-tomiyama.pdf 「宮古八重山津波」(1771 年) における災害・年貢・復興について —石垣島と多良間島を中心に—」] 豊見山和行 (Tomiyama, Kazuyuki) University of the Ryukyus Repository (Retrieved on May 13, 2009) {{ja}} [http://ir.lib.u-ryukyu.ac.jp/handle/123456789/8549 Index] (Retrieved on May 13, 2009)</ref> The island provided the scene for the arrest of one of the perpetrators of [[Aum Shinrikyo]]'s [[Sarin gas attack on the Tokyo subway|sarin gas attack]], [[Sarin gas attack on the Tokyo subway#Yasuo Hayashi|Yasuo Hayashi]], 21 months after and 1000 miles away from where the crime took place. Ishigaki Port will be expanded so that five large Japanese coast guard patrol boats can be stationed there.<ref>[http://japandailypress.com/japan-coast-guard-to-form-600-member-unit-tasked-solely-with-patrolling-senkakus-3122472 "Japan Coast Guard to form 600-member unit tasked solely with patrolling Senkakus."]</ref> ==Culture== * [[Miyaradunchi]] == Gallery == <gallery> File:Ishigaki bay seen from southern gate bridge.jpg|Ishigaki Bay, seen from Southern Gate Bridge.
